file_content.text: Doctor Godera... the Sith killed him. Damn them!
The doctor was a brilliant man. He served the Republic with loyalty and dedication.
My condolences, General.
I didn't know him well, but I think he'd rather we keep fighting than stop to mourn him.
I wish the people who believe we can make peace with the Empire could see this.
Please give Master Satele my regards. Today, the Jedi saved Corellia three times over.
I'll be right behind you. We'll keep the Empire's forces off your back long enough to reach that turbolift. Good luck, my old friend.
We're at the point of no return, my friend. Win or lose, this is where we'll make our stand.
Erris Wyum is with Corellian Intelligence. He's just learned our job here is even harder than we thought.
My reconnaissance teams just picked up an energy surge coming from the reactors on that Imperial battle cruiser.
We believe the cruiser's reactors are being overloaded--building to detonation.
Master Braga sabotaged his battle cruiser. He's using it to destroy this whole sector.
It's a suicide attack.
Why not simply crash it into the surface?
Get a message to the Imperial officers aboard that cruiser. Tell them what's happening.
Warn the ship's crew.
We've tried. No response from them--not even insults. For all we know, the command crew is dead.
We've stopped his other plans. A suicide attack is the only option that idiot has left.
Braga is a desperate fool.
If Master Braga wants to destroy his own ship, why not crash it into the surface?
A reactor detonation at its present altitude won't just flatten this sector. The radiation released will kill people for hundreds of kilometers.
Good news is, there's a secure turbolift connecting the cruiser to the government buildings. They use it to send troops there.
Your strike team will use that to get inside the cruiser, shut down those reactors and deal with Master Braga.
This will be different. Usually, I run away from exploding enemy cruisers....
Let's hope it's that easy.
I have absolute confidence you'll survive this. If I'm wrong, we won't live to regret it.
If Master Braga sees me coming, he might detonate the reactors early.
Frontal assaults are risky.
I have a plan to distract him and buy you the element of surprise.
Can't wait to see the their faces when I arrive with all my friends.
I should take my army, too.
You can't take the enemy by surprise with an army of Jedi--but don't worry, your people will have plenty to do.
I'm commanding a platoon of Republic troops. With your Jedi squads backing us, we'll hit enemy command-and-control centers all over this area.
We'll keep the enemy's attention off your strike team and retake Capitol Square for the Republic.
Without all these Jedi, I'd say you were crazy to even try it--but you just might pull this off, General.
My people won't let you down.
The Force is with him.
I wish there were more Jedi for this mission. It would improve your odds of success.
My people are battle-hardened and ready for anything.
They'll be enough.
I'm counting on that.
It's rare to see a general charging into battle.
Should you be going out there?
None of us can afford to play it safe. This is all or nothing.
Keep your goals realistic. All I need is for you to clear my path.
Don't be a hero.
I'll do that, and then some.
This is it, friends. May the Force be with us.
Is it too late to go back to Balmorra?
Better yet, may it not be with the bad guys.
Enough platitudes. Let's end this.
Victory or death! For the Republic!
Jedi + Force + T7 = unstoppable combination // Onward!
Doctor Godera meant well, but the weapons he designed nearly destroyed the Republic. Some might say we are safer without him.
This is neither good nor bad.
Some might say he's the only reason the Republic survived this long.
I'll burn his name into every enemy I kill here.
I'll avenge him.
I know he'd appreciate the gesture.
All enemies accounted for, General. I found Doctor Godera's work. Looks important.
He was tracking Master Braga's holotransmissions. He found... signals coming from an Imperial battle cruiser hovering above Capitol Square.
He found Master Braga. I need to get inside that battle cruiser right now.
That's where I'm going.
Why would the Empire bring a warship down to the planet surface?
It isn't in orbit?
We assumed it was to intimidate us. Maybe it's something worse.
Master Braga's gone insane, and now he has a warship at his command. Blow them both out of the sky.
Shoot it down.
That would inflict massive civilian casualties in the heart of Corellia. We need a better plan.
Republic troops established a small forward base in the government district. Gather your people and meet me there.
Senator Zackin sends his regards. Your Jedi troops freed all his Corellian "citizens" with no casualties.
Meanwhile, those Imperial murderers who slaughtered our wounded are laughing all the way back to Dromund Kaas.
My mission here is to save lives, not take them.
I made the right choice.
I'll never understand you people.
If they're not on Corellia, they're no threat to us.
At least they're gone.
What about the next planet those killers are sent to?
It's only a temporary reprieve. Someday, they'll pay for what they've done.
They'll get theirs.
They should have died today.
Your Jedi troops caught the Imperials off guard. Wiped out every one of those murdering scum.
You lost a squad in the battle, but they went down fighting. Their sacrifice meant something.
Thanks for doing the right thing. I found you some top-of-the-line advanced combat gear.
I'll put this gear to good use. I'd better get going.
Thank you, Colonel.
Kick those Imperials into the nearest sun, Supreme Commander!
Glad I don't have to remind you about our agreement.
I thought you'd forgotten.
I'd never cheat a Jedi. It's bad luck.
I'm a little underwhelmed, Colonel.
Is that it?
They were all out of heavy artillery walkers. Best I could do.
I'll transmit the coordinates of our forward base to all your people and have them meet you there. Good luck.
What are you doing here? The Sith are preparing that chemical bomb. Get to the factory!
General, I've shut down the chemical pipelines.
Stand by. Agent Helver is collating the data. Did you run into much trouble out there?
Toxic smoke, killer droids, enemy patrols. The usual.
You could say that.
Is it me, or have you grown a sense of humor?
There were a few troublemakers who soon saw the error of their ways.
Nothing I couldn't handle.
Forgot how much fun it is to work with you....
Is asking stupid questions one of your core competencies, General?
What do you think, idiot?
Forgot how irritable you can be....
Hang on, we're getting something.... One of the chemical plants was siphoning accellerite. We've found our Sith bomb makers.
I'm sending the coordinates to you and your strike team now. They'll meet you inside. Hurry!
Shut down those chemical pipelines so we can find the Empire's forces. Hurry!
General, my forces are on the way.
Glad to hear it. An agent with SIS is bringing us the latest intel on Master Tol Braga.
In the meantime, we should form a battle plan to drive the Empire from this sector. It's running riot here.
Magremme Thrakus is one of the chief suppliers of the Republic's war effort. She owns half the facilities in Labor Valley.
The Empire "appropriated" my weapon factories. They're stealing billions of credits worth of firepower.
My forces will retake this entire sector, starting with your factories.
Not for long.
I hope so. They've been in my family for generations.
What sort of armament is the Empire taking?
What kind of weapons?
My factories produce everything from personal blasters to capital ship torpedoes. The Empire is looting all of it.
Should be easy to defend a munitions plant from hostile takeover. Everything you need is there.
And you're letting them.
I manufacture weapons, not soldiers.
I recommend devoting all Jedi forces to removing the enemy from those weapon factories. We certainly need munitions more than the Empire.
That's a priority signal from the Supreme Chancellor. Excuse me....
There is more to this than weapons, you know. The Empire also seized my company's base of operations. I want it back.
If you were to allocate forces toward liberating my corporate offices, I'd be extremely grateful--and I do mean personally.
Jedi aren't for hire, and the general believes your weapon factories are more important.
I'm not sure about this.
The general doesn't see the big picture. My company possesses many valuable assets.
Why would the Empire raid your corporate offices?
What's your motive?
I've never trusted Corellia's banking system. I convert all my company's monetary reserves into precious resources. Many are hidden beneath the offices.
The Empire hasn't found my resources yet, but given enough time, they will. There's no telling what they could do with all that wealth.
I appreciate personal gratitude, assuming it's actually worth my time.
Make a specific offer.
I run a multi-trillion credit corporation. If you help me, you won't be disappointed with your reward.
Everyone is here and ready to face the enemy on your command. May the Force be with us.
Your forces are ready for duty, Supreme Commander.
Master Kiwiiks, I haven't seen you since Coruscant. That's an impressive bunch you've brought.
Never seen this many Jedi in one place. Blasted impressive.
If we're going to retake those weapon factories, your people need to go now.
We're on it, General.
I want those weapon factories cleared of all Imperial forces. Don't let the enemy escape with any munitions.
I suppose you're right.
New information has come to light, General. I believe Thrakus's corporate offices is the more important objective. I'm sending all forces there.
No, we're saving the offices.
I don't understand. That office building has no strategic value.
If I have my company, I can build more weapons. It's business, General.
I will communicate your orders to the others.
I'll deliver the orders at once.
General Var Suthra... we've learned the Jedi traitor Tol Braga has sent a strike team to destroy Labor Valley.
What could destroy this entire sector?
That requires quite a weapon.
Tol Braga is a good man. Whatever he's doing, it's not of his own free will.
He isn't a traitor.
With all due respect, I couldn't care less why he's trying to kill us.
If I can get to Master Braga, I'll end these threats for good. Where is he?
Do you know where Braga is?
We're tracing his holomessages, but there's too much chaos on the comm frequencies to get his location.
The Sith have invaded a chemical refinery to create an improvised bomb. The explosion will release a massive toxic cloud.
That cloud will kill everyone here and drift into the adjacent sectors. Potentially millions of fatalities.
Point me to this chemical refinery. I'll handle the rest.
Then we'd better move fast.
A weapon that indiscriminately kills friend and foe alike. The Sith are on a suicide mission.
Including the Sith.
Perhaps they're as deluded as Executor Krannus was on Belsavis.
I'd rather put them out of our misery personally. How do we do that?
Send a general retreat. We don't want to be anywhere near this bomb when it goes off.
We have to pull back.
We'll never evacuate everyone in time. Besides, there are civilians to consider.
We still don't know which chemical refinery the Sith have, but we do know which chemicals they're gathering.
Shutting down all the chemical pipelines feeding the refineries won't stop the Sith. However, it will give away their location.
Contact me when it's done. May the Force be with you all.
You'll have to wait. I'm in the middle of something.
We have coordinates to the turbolift. We'll keep a low profile, split up and rendezvous there quietly. The enemy will never know.
All due respect, General, a platoon of normal soldiers and two squads of Jedi won't be enough to accomplish that.
Great victories have been won with less. Don't give in to fear.
There is always hope.
Wasn't planning to give up. Not my style.
We're getting battle reports from your Jedi forces. They're wrapping up their missions now.
You lost a squad fighting those Imperials that slaughtered our soldiers--but no enemies survived. I call that a victory.
Your people took out almost all the Imperial scum who were killing our wounded soldiers. Looks like you lost a squad, though.
You lost another freeing the Corellian "citizens" from the slave camps. The Senator offers his condolences.
Cost you a squad, but your people taught those Imperials a lesson. The ones who aren't dead know better than to attack wounded soldiers.
The rest of your people freed the Corellian "citizens" without any trouble. The Senator offers his warmest regards.
Another Jedi squad died while freeing the Corellian "citizens." The Senator offers his condolences.
The squad you sent after the Corellian "citizens" freed a couple before having to retreat. The Senator isn't happy, but who cares?
Wish you'd sent more people after those Imperials who slaughtered our wounded soldiers. Most of that scum got away, and you lost a squad.
You sent more than enough to free the Senator's Corellian "citizens." No casualties reported.
But the Senator offers his thanks for freeing the Corellian "citizens." No casualties there.
Even worse, you lost another one freeing the Corellian "citizens." The Senator offers thanks--and condolences.
Wasn't much point in sending a lone squad to attack those Imperials. Your people barely made a dent in that murdering filth before retreating.
Meanwhile, the Corellian "citizens" were all freed without incident. The Senator offers his warmest regards.
I appreciate the status report, but I'm needed elsewhere.
Thank you for the update.
I'm glad to know my forces are making a difference out there.
My people do good work.
The enemy is taking notice, that's for sure.
If these losses continue, I won't have much of an army left.
We're losing too many Jedi.
Next time, put all your people on the same mission--and bet on the sure thing.
I committed forces to your mission. You promised me advanced combat gear.
You still owe me gear.
I requisitioned the best combat gear I could get you. It's not much, but it's yours.
You did lose a squad, though. Too bad you didn't have more forces to commit. Probably would've made a difference.
No casualties on your end either. It's a good day.
Your Jedi gave us a boost, but odds are still fifty-fifty.
The news isn't so good on this end. We drove the Empire from a few weapon factories and saved Thrakus's corporate headquarters.
But I'm afraid your losses were heavy. Two Jedi squads died in the fighting. I'm sorry.
I'll have to use my squads more carefully from now on.
That's almost half my people.
The hardest part of leading troops is learning to focus on what's most important. Dividing forces leaves both halves vulnerable.
Dozens of pipelines run through this sector. We can't expect one Jedi to shut down all of them.
The Outer Rim Jedi have left, but the rest of us could form a strike team.
I already sent out our main forces, but we can search with you. We'll be your strike team.
I'll divide the chemical pipelines among all of you. Shut them down, and we'll pinpoint the Sith's location.
Half of my forces will push the Empire out of those factories. The rest will liberate Thrakus's corporate offices.
[Save both objectives.]
That office building has no strategic value whatsoever, but it's your call.
My company's survival is at stake. The Jedi understands this.
Supreme Commander, we'll deliver Master Kiwiiks's body to the nearest medcenter and wait for orders.
Well done, Supreme Commander. We'll sweep this area for surviving Sith and then rendezvous with our main forces.
